intro: Eschatogramme desvauxii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has succulent leaves and stems, which help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Eschatogramme desvauxii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
